itemMeta.title: France: Hollande lays out plan to tackle Boko Haram

contentMeta.headline: Francois Hollande, French President (in French): "That's the message we want to send. We know the threat is serious. It is dangerous for the region, Africa and so for Europe. We have already made an information system and deployed information to find the girls. Finally we have decided on an action plan for the medium term with the five countries represented here, I mean African countries, France, the United States, Europe, able to act in cooperation, unity and efficiency."
contentMeta.description:
French President Francois Hollande spoke on the topic of the abduction of over 200 Nigerian school girls by Boko Haram, during a press conference in Paris on Saturday.
Hollande stated that leaders of five African countries present at the event, as well as Europe and the United States have agreed on a plan to jointly tackle the matter. The press conference followed a meeting with Nigerian President Goodluck Jonathan, who was in Paris for a conference with leaders and representatives of West African countries on the topic of the kidnapping. Intelligence sharing and joint border patrols were among the points of cooperation agreed to by leaders.
Leaders of Nigeria, Benin, Cameroon, Chad and Niger attended the Paris meeting at the Elysee Palace. Representatives of the US, the European Union and UK also took part.
